intro: Pavetta baconia var. oblongifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf pavetta, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its elliptical to oblong leaves that are often glossy and arranged oppositely along the stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with white petals and yellow stamens, typically blooming in the spring. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. The leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
